name: Aikaterini A. Sotiraki
content: Katerina Sotirakiaikaterini.sotiraki@yale.edu Assistant ProfessorYale UniversityArchimedes AIBiographyI am an assistant professor in the Computer Science department at Yale University. Before Yale, I was a postdoc at UC Berkeley working with Raluca Ada Popa and Alessandro Chiesa. I completed my Ph.D. at MIT, where I was advised by Vinod Vaikuntanathan.InterestsTheoretical CryptographyPost-Quantum CryptographyComplexity TheorySecure ComputationEducationPhD in Computer Science, 2020Massachusetts Institute of TechnologyMSc in Computer Science, 2016Massachusetts Institute of TechnologyBSc in Applied Mathematics, 2013National Technical University of AthensPublicationsHOLMES: Efficient Distribution Testing for Secure Collaborative LearningIan Chang, Katerina Sotiraki, Weikeng Chen, Murat Kantarcioglu, Raluca Ada PopaUSENIX Security, 2023Cite Abstract eprint CodeLattice-Based Succinct Arguments for NP with Polylogarithmic-Time VerificationJonathan Bootle, Alessandro Chiesa, Katerina SotirakiCRYPTO, 2023Cite Abstract eprintSumcheck Arguments and Their ApplicationsJonathan Bootle, Alessandro Chiesa, Katerina SotirakiCRYPTO, 2021Cite Abstract eprintA Topological Characterization of Modulo-p Arguments and Implications for Necklace SplittingAris Filos-Ratsikas, Alexandros Hollender, Katerina Sotiraki, Manolis ZampetakisSODA, 2021Cite Abstract arXivConsensus-Halving: Does It Ever Get Easier?Aris Filos-Ratsikas, Alexandros Hollender, Katerina Sotiraki, Manolis ZampetakisEC, 2020 (Appeared in SIAM Journal on Computing)Cite Abstract arXivLimits on the Efficiency of (Ring) LWE Based Non-interactive Key ExchangeSiyao Guo, Pritish Kamath, Alon Rosen, Katerina SotirakiPKC, 2020 (Appeared in Journal of Cryptology)Cite Abstract eprintOn the Complexity of Modulo-q Arguments and the Chevalley - Warning TheoremMika Göös, Pritish Kamath, Katerina Sotiraki, Manolis ZampetakisCCC, 2020Cite Abstract arXivTowards Non-Interactive Zero-Knowledge for NP from LWERon D.
